sentences.english: By 1916, more than half the states held presidential primaries.
sentences.chinese: 到1916年，有半数以上的州举行总统初选。

sentences.english: By 1936, only a dozen states continued to hold presidential primaries.
sentences.chinese: 到1936年，只有十来个州继续举行总统初选。

sentences.english: The Illinois stop was particularly important because of the primary calendar.
sentences.chinese: 鉴于初选日程安排，伊利诺伊州这一站尤显重要。

sentences.english: We had won the nomination by organizing around the primary schedule.
sentences.chinese: 我们围绕初选进度组织管理，所以赢得了提名。

sentences.english: The Socialists will choose their candidate in a primary vote in October.
sentences.chinese: 社会党人将在十月份的初选中选出他们的总统候选人。

sentences.english: Your party choice applies only to the King County primary ballot you complete in August.
sentences.chinese: 你所选的政党只应用于在景郡初选你填的选票。

sentences.english: And then again turn over verification the model number of doing the machine of the freezing of primary election.
sentences.chinese: 而后再反过来验证所初选的冻干机的型号。

sentences.english: The usual rule in primaries is that voters flock to thew inning candidate.
sentences.chinese: 初选通常的规律是选民们会纷纷涌向获胜的候选人。

sentences.english: Objective: Primarily to select absorption accelerating agent of nasal absorption preparation for calcitonin gene related peptide.
sentences.chinese: 鼻腔给药制剂的吸收促进剂进行初选。

sentences.english: Still, I couldn’t take the primary for granted.
sentences.chinese: 尽管如此，我仍然不能对初选掉以轻心。

sentences.english: Hayworth, whom he trounced in the Arizona Senate primary in August).
sentences.chinese: 他在八月亚利桑那州议会初选时严责了海华斯。

sentences.english: The U. S. Supreme Court ruled Washington's blanket primary to be unconstitutional.
sentences.chinese: 美国最高法院裁判华盛顿州的公开初选有违宪法。

sentences.english: Fernando Torres has been included in Spain's 30-man preliminary squad for the World Cup finals in South Africa.
sentences.chinese: 托雷斯进入了西班牙世界杯决赛的30人初选名单。

sentences.english: Clinton won the Texas primary vote 51 to 47 percent.
sentences.chinese: 克林顿曾赢得得州初选51%到47%的选票。

sentences.english: It has been an honor to contest these primaries with him.
sentences.chinese: 我一直感到很荣幸和他一起经历了这些初选。

sentences.english: Hillary party primaries in 2008, won the support of these groups.
sentences.chinese: 喜莱莉在2008年党内初选时，赢得这些族群支持。

definition: to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
to fail to be chosen (or elected)/to lose an election
preliminary contest/initial heats of a competition
to select on the basis of a vote or consensus
direct, winner-takes-all system of election in use for village committees/preselection for a competition
to determine the recipient of an award through discussion
(sports) semifinal or quarterfinal/to compete in a semifinal (or a quarterfinal)
